messages.title: Labour’s Ward Initiative
messages.content: Your local Councillors won funding from the Council for £30,000 to fix a very potholed road, have a community skip day, improve a park, and award £10,000 to the Golborne Festival.

messages.title: Vote Labour on 6 May - or you could lose a lot...
messages.content: We Golborne Councillors work hard to represent you in Golborne Ward. We got the Council to allocate £1.5 million to improve Golborne Road, made sure the Community Kitchen opens...

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's housing policy would reduce the number of social rented homes being forcibly sold; keep people in the community; make renovations to lease properties cheaper.

mentions.tacticalSituation: noting Lib Dem or Green will only mean a Tory Kensington

housing.content: Labour's housing policy would: Reduce the number of social rented homes being forcibly sold - Keep people in the community - Make renovations to lease properties cheaper.

leaflet.personalStatement: On May 6th we have a crucial decision to make about the future of our community

politicalExperience.achievements: Won funding from the Council for £30,000 for community improvements, allocated £1.5 million to improve Golborne Road, and many other locally focused achievements.

quotes.text: The Tories are threatening to effectively abolish social housing without replacement. This must not be allowed to happen!
It is a travesty that the RBKC has not approved a CrossRail station for North Kensington. The economic and landmark rating was never understood.

images.caption: A candidate photo and message, housing policy, endorsement quotes, and local initiatives are depicted.
